alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Howard; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Greeley, Valley, northern Sherman and northern Howard Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 215 AM CDT, automated weather stations reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles northeast of Burwell to near Ord to Loup City. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Automated Weather Station. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Ashton around 225 AM CDT. Cotesfield around 235 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Elba, Spalding, Wolbach and Cushing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for central Nebraska.
